intro.description: This tutorial explains how to create detector mask and use it in NCD data reduction

item.title: Open detector image
item.description: Open image file from "Project Explorer" and plot it in the "Dataset plot" view in 2D image mode.

item.title: Open mask creation sideplot
item.description: Select "Switch sideplot into mask creation mode" button in the "Dataset plot" toolbar.

item.title: Setting masked intensity thresholds
item.description: "Mask above" and "Mask below" checkboxes activate thresholds for masking pixels with the intensities above or below the levels set in the adjacent spinner controls, respectively.

item.title: Using mask drawing tool
item.description: "Pen properties" panel holds settings for drawing pen size, shape and a switch between draw and erase modes. "Clear" button deletes current mask and "Undo/Redo" button reverts last mask change.

item.title: Applying detector mask in data reduction
item.description: Selecting "Apply detector mask" checkbox in "Experimental Parameters" panel of "NCD data reduction parameters" view will apply active mask in data reduction process.
